question.title: Fabric8 k8s client catch warnings in Java
question.body:
I'm interested in the warnings which are potentially reported by a webhook in k8s. When connecting to the k8s cluster using the Fabric8 k8s client, those warnings are ignored. I believe I need to implement a custom vert.x http client (using fabric8s 7.2.0's default client) and catch the warning headers. However, I can't figure out how to override the default client. Can't find any docs. Please help me solve by providing any pointers are a complete implementation of the missing code. This is used in the context of a Quarkus app so I'm curious to provide a custom implementation through cdi.

@ApplicationScoped
public class KubernetesClientProducer {
    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger("KubernetesClientProducer");

    @Produces
    public KubernetesClient kubernetesClient() {
        Config config = new ConfigBuilder().build();

        .........

        return new KubernetesClientBuilder()
                .withConfig(config)
                .withHttpClientFactory(factory)
                .build();
    }
}
